newsitem.title: USA: Freeport-McMoRan stock up despite Busang.
newsitem.headline: Freeport-McMoRan stock up despite Busang.

text.p: Freeport-McMoRan Copper & Gold Inc eked out a gain for the day despite discouraging news about the much ballyhooed Busang project that Freeport-McMoRan and Canada's Bre-X Minerals Ltd were to jointly develop.
The Louisiana-based mining giant's stock rose $0.50 to 30-1/8. Bre-X stock, however sank C$13 to C$2.50 a share on Thursday.

Busang was supposed to be one of largest gold finds of the century, but instead Freeport-McMoRan said this week that the location in East Kalimantan, Indonesia may have "insignificant" amounts of the valuable ore.
The jury was still out on the project, analysts and Bre-X officials said.
Freeport-McMoRan emerged relatively unscathed from the debacle because the firm had only recently gotten into the venture with Bre-X and never actually owned anything.
"They had an option to acquire 15 percent of it and they still have that option, but they did not have it yet," said Victor Lazarovici of Smith Barney.
In a statement on Wednesday, Freeport-McMoRan said it "will elect to participate in the development of the Busang project only if development is...economically feasible."

Analysts said the disappointing news would not affect earnings estimates because they had not yet factored Busang into Freeport-McMoRan's numbers. According to First Call financial service, analysts are predicting earnings of around $1.11 per share this year, up from $0.89, on revenues of $1.97 billion, in 1996.
Lazarovici said he had raised the company's stock target price to $38, but on Wednesday trimmed it to a pre-Busang $34.50.
"We remain and have every confidence that there is the reserve potential in the Busang property that we have stated," Bre-X chief executive David Walsh told reporters in Calgary on Thursday.
The company has hired Strathcona Mineral Services Ltd, a mining consultant, to conduct an audit of the drilling and sampling programs done by both Bre-X and Freeport-McMoRan.
